detaileddescription.para: All alphanumeric characters except for "0", "I", "O", and "l"

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *psz, std::vector< unsigned char > &vch, int max_ret_len)
memberdef.name: DecodeBase58

detaileddescription.para:
Why base-58 instead of standard base-64 encoding?
Don't want 0OIl characters that look the same in some fonts and could be used to create visually identical looking data.
A string with non-alphanumeric characters is not as easily accepted as input.
E-mail usually won't line-break if there's no punctuation to break at.
Double-clicking selects the whole string as one word if it's all alphanumeric. Encode a byte span as a base58-encoded string

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &str, std::vector< unsigned char > &vchRet, int max_ret_len)
memberdef.name: DecodeBase58

detaileddescription.para: Decode a base58-encoded string (str) into a byte vector (vchRet). return true if decoding is successful.
Encode a byte span into a base58-encoded string, including checksum

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *psz, std::vector< unsigned char > &vchRet, int max_ret_len)
memberdef.name: DecodeBase58Check

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &str, std::vector< unsigned char > &vchRet, int max_ret)
memberdef.name: DecodeBase58Check

detaileddescription.para: Decode a base58-encoded string (str) that includes a checksum into a byte vector (vchRet), return true if decoding is successful
Check if a string does not contain any embedded NUL (\0) characters
